Class Account

java.lang.Object
Account
Direct Known Subclasses:
CreditAccount, DebitAccount, SavingsAccount
public abstract class Account extends Object
Abstract base class representing a general-purpose bank account entity.

Each Account instance is uniquely identified by an account ID, associated with a Customer, and characterized by specific financial attributes such as IBAN, balance, currency, and creation date.

The Account class provides shared functionality and structure for all specialized account types: DebitAccount, SavingsAccount, and CreditAccount. Each of these subclasses implements its own version of the applyMonthlyUpdate() method to reflect the unique financial behavior of that account type â€” for example, adding interest for savings accounts, charging interest for credit accounts, or leaving balances unchanged for debit accounts.

IBAN format (Western European, simplified):
CCkkBBBBSSSSXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
where:

  • CC = country code (e.g., RO, DE)
  • kk = checksum digits
  • BBBBSSSS = bank identifier and branch code
  • X... = account number

  • Constructor Details

    • Account

      public Account(char type, Customer customer, String iban, double balance, String currency)
      Constructs a new Account for a given Customer, generating or validating all required account attributes. Automatically assigns an account ID and IBAN if not provided and validates input data before object creation.
      Parameters:
      type - account type (debit, savings, credit)
      customer - the Customer who owns this account
      iban - unique IBAN; if null, one is auto-generated
      balance - initial balance
      currency - currency code ("RON", "EUR", "USD")
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails for any input parameter

    • Account

      public Account(char type, String accountId, String customerId, String iban, double balance, String currency, String country, String accountHolder, LocalDate creationDate)
      Constructs a fully specified Account using all known attributes.

      This constructor is typically used when loading account data from persistent storage (e.g., a file or database).

      Parameters:
      type - character representing account type ('D', 'S', 'C')
      accountId - internal system account ID
      customerId - unique customer identifier associated with this account
      iban - the full IBAN of the account
      balance - the current or stored balance of the account
      currency - ISO currency code (e.g., "RON", "EUR")
      country - two-letter ISO country code
      accountHolder - full name of the account owner
      creationDate - date when the account was originally created

    • Account

      public Account(char type, String accountId, Customer customer, String iban, double balance, String currency)
      Constructs an Account using a manually provided account ID.

      This version of the constructor is used when account IDs are externally controlled (e.g., during data migration or synchronization with another system).

      Parameters:
      type - character representing account type ('D', 'S', or 'C')
      accountId - manually provided account ID (must not be blank)
      customer - the Customer who owns this account
      iban - predefined IBAN (optional); generated automatically if null or blank
      balance - initial or restored balance
      currency - ISO currency code (e.g., "RON", "EUR")
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails for type, accountId, or currency

    • addTransaction

      public void addTransaction(String type, double amount, String description)
      Adds a new transaction to the account's transaction list.

      Used to maintain a complete history of all debit, credit, and transfer operations performed on this account.

      Parameters:
      type - transaction type descriptor (e.g., "Deposit", "Withdrawal")
      amount - transaction amount in account currency
      description - optional text describing the transaction details

    • deposit

      public void deposit(double amount)
      Deposits a specified positive amount into the account balance.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to deposit; must be greater than zero
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if amount â‰¤ 0

    • withdraw

      public void withdraw(double amount)
      Withdraws a specified amount from the account, ensuring sufficient funds exist.

      The operation will fail if the balance is insufficient or if the amount is invalid.

      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to withdraw
      Throws:
      InvalidAmountException - if the specified amount is zero or negative
      InsufficientFundsException - if withdrawal exceeds available balance

    • applyMonthlyUpdate

      public abstract void applyMonthlyUpdate()
      Abstract method representing the monthly update logic for the account.

      Each subclass defines how the account evolves monthly:

      • DebitAccount â†’ no changes are applied
      • SavingsAccount â†’ interest is added to the balance
      • CreditAccount â†’ debt interest is applied

    • generateIban

      protected static String generateIban(String accountId, String country)
      Generates a random IBAN string for demonstration or testing purposes. The method uses the given country and accountId to build a pseudo-realistic IBAN following a Western European structure.
      Parameters:
      accountId - internal system account ID (used as suffix)
      country - two-letter ISO country code
      Returns:
      formatted pseudo-random IBAN

    • isBlank

      protected static boolean isBlank(String s)
      Utility method to determine if a string is null, empty, or contains only whitespace.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to evaluate
      Returns:
      true if the string is blank, otherwise false
